data.description: Job Description SummaryCome and join our powerful, unified force with the energy to change the world. Our mission is BIG.Our TRANSFORMATION is key – bringing the right businesses together to LEAD the ENERGY TRANSITION. Our TEAM is ready.Addressing the climate crisis is an urgent global priority and we take our responsibility seriously. Building on over 130 years of experience tackling the world’s challenges, GE Vernova is uniquely positioned to help lead the energy transition by continuing to electrify the world while simultaneously working to decarbonize it. GE Vernova helps customers power economies and deliver electricity that is vital to health, safety, security, and improved quality of life.Job DescriptionIf you are passionate about technology and eager to make a real impact in manufacturing, then this robotics internship will immerse you in a hands-on project that combines data analysis, process mapping, and innovation in automation. You’ll work closely with experts in robotics, AI, engineering, production, and quality to help shape the future of our manufacturing processes.The aim of this initiative is to explore the feasibility and define the robotics requirements for key subassemblies of our products across our footprint, as well as to define an optimal strategy to scale up robotics initiatives across the board.Project Scope:Analyze production volumes and manufacturing capacity for various product variants across factories to identify high-runner and low-runner models, assess performance trends, and gain actionable insights for optimizing production across product families.Perform an in-depth analysis of critical manufacturing processes, applying a continuous improvement mindset to identify opportunities for streamlining performance, enhancing quality, and optimizing the tools and steps involved in operations.Collaborate with a robotic integrator to assess manufacturing processes for automation potential, and contribute to redesigning processes to eliminate inefficiencies and enhance overall productivity.Explore state-of-the-art robotic solutions in leading industries and bring fresh ideas to enhance our operations.Engage with stakeholders across our global manufacturing footprint—including engineering, production, and quality—to gather insights and actively drive process improvements.Develop innovative concept designs for flexible robotic cells by creating layout sketches, planning optimized workflows, and incorporating stakeholder feedback to enhance manufacturing processes.Support strategic decision-making on the deployment of robotic cells by assessing where, why, how, and when to invest, proposing smart deployment options, and establishing criteria for success.Develop, update, and present comprehensive business cases and financial models for identified initiatives, detailing ROI, production volumes, associated risks, and other key metrics.Primary Skills Developed:Technical and Analytical SkillsRobotics and Automation Knowledge: Hands-on experience with robotic systems, automation technologies, and their integration in manufacturing environments.Data Analysis: Ability to collect, interpret, and leverage production data for decision-making using analytical tools.Process Mapping and Optimization: Skills in mapping current processes, identifying inefficiencies, and designing improvements. Project and Concept DevelopmentDesign and Modeling: Exposure to CAD tools for designing flexible robotic cells and creating layout sketches.Business Case Analysis: Building and updating financial models, assessing ROI, and evaluating risks associated with automation initiatives.Continuous ImprovementLean Manufacturing: Application of continuous improvement methodologies to streamline operations and enhance quality.Problem-Solving: Practical experience in identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.Collaboration and CommunicationCross-Functional Teamwork: Working with stakeholders across engineering, production, quality, and finance to gather insights and drive change.Presentation Skills: Communicating findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.Internship Term Dates:May/June - August 2026 Qualifications:Pursuing a graduate degree in engineering (robotics, mechatronics, mechanical, electrical, industrial, or related fields), computer science, or a relevant technical discipline).Minimum GPA 4.0 / 5.0 scale.Benefits Available to you: Addressing the climate crisis is an urgent global priority, and at GE Vernova, we take our responsibility seriously. That is the singular mission of GE Vernova: to continue electrifying the world while simultaneously working to help decarbonize it. In order to meet this mission, we provide varied, competitive benefits to help support our workforce: Our Culture | GE Vernova (gecareers.com)The pay for this position is $34/hr.This position is also eligible for:Relocation Assistance: Co-op/Interns will be reimbursed for reasonable, proper, and documented expenditures incurred while initially reporting to work and returning to school/home upon completion of the assignment. Employees with a permanent address greater than 50 miles away from the work location are eligible.Housing Allowance: Co-op/Interns employees receive a weekly housing allowance to help off-set living expenses when the co-op/Intern’s permanent residence is at least 50 miles away from the work location.Employee Assistance Program, providing 24/7 confidential assessment, counseling and referral servicesGE Retirement Savings Plan (RSP) after their accumulated service reaches 90 days, and they meet any other eligibility requirements as defined in the plans. (Eligibility occurs on the 1st of the month following the 90th day.)General Electric Company, Ropcor, Inc., their successors, and in some cases their affiliates, each sponsor certain employee benefit plans or programs (i.e., is a Sponsor”). Each Sponsor reserves the right to terminate, amend, suspend, replace, or modify its benefit plans and programs at any time and for any reason, in its sole discretion. No individual has a vested right to any benefit under a Sponsor’s welfare benefit plan or program. This document does not create a contract of employment with any individual.Inclusion At GE Vernova, we believe in the value of your unique identity, background and experiences. We are committed to fostering an inclusive culture, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work because they feel accepted, respected and that they belong. Click here to learn more: https://jobs.gecareers.com/vernova/global/en/i-d-eAdditional InformationGE Vernova offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE Vernova is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.GE Vernova will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). Relocation Assistance Provided: No
